results.title: Different effects of metformin and phenformin on hypoxia-induced Ca2+ fluxes in cultured primary neurons.
results.text_hl: Recent evidence suggests that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Phenformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010629 @@@phenformin@@@ may exert beneficial effects against @DISEASE_Nerve_Degeneration @DISEASE_MESH:D009410 @@@neuronal injury@@@ in the @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020520 @@@ischemic brain@@@, however, the difference of action between these two drugs and the molecular mechanism of such protection is not clear.

citations.NLM: Svirskiene N, Pampuscenko K, Svirskis G, Borutaite V. Different effects of metformin and phenformin on hypoxia-induced Ca2+ fluxes in cultured primary neurons. Brain Res. 2021 Jan 1;1750():147151. PMID: 33039412
citations.BibTeX: @article{33039412, title={Different effects of metformin and phenformin on hypoxia-induced Ca2+ fluxes in cultured primary neurons.}, author={Svirskiene N and Pampuscenko K and Svirskis G and Borutaite V}, journal={Brain Res}, volume={1750}, pages={147151}}

results.title: Pre-stroke Metformin Treatment is Neuroprotective Involving AMPK Reduction.
results.text_hl: The expressions of total and phosphorylated AMPK were sharply decreased with effective @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ pretreatments in @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020520 @@@ischemic brains@@@.

citations.NLM: Deng T, Zheng YR, Hou WW, Yuan Y, Shen Z, Wu XL, Chen Y, Zhang LS, Hu WW, Chen Z, Zhang XN. Pre-stroke Metformin Treatment is Neuroprotective Involving AMPK Reduction. Neurochem Res. 2016 Oct;41(10):2719-2727. PMID: 27350579
citations.BibTeX: @article{27350579, title={Pre-stroke Metformin Treatment is Neuroprotective Involving AMPK Reduction.}, author={Deng T and Zheng YR and Hou WW and Yuan Y and Shen Z and Wu XL and Chen Y and Zhang LS and Hu WW and Chen Z and Zhang XN}, journal={Neurochem Res}, volume={41}, number={10}, pages={2719-2727}}

results.title: Metformin treatment after the hypoxia-ischemia attenuates brain injury in newborn rats
results.text_hl: Here, we found that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment remarkably attenuated @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020520 @@@brain infarct@@@ volumes and @DISEASE_Brain_Edema @DISEASE_MESH:D001929 @@@brain edema@@@ at 24 h after @DISEASE_Hypoxia_Ischemia_Brain @DISEASE_MESH:D020925 @@@HI injury@@@, and the neuroprotection of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ was associated with inhibition of neuronal apoptosis, suppression of the @DISEASE_Neuroinflammatory_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D000090862 @@@neuroinflammation@@@ and amelioration of the blood brain barrier breakdown.

citations.NLM: Fang M, Jiang H, Ye L, Cai C, Hu Y, Pan S, Li P, Xiao J, Lin Z. Metformin treatment after the hypoxia-ischemia attenuates brain injury in newborn rats Oncotarget. 2017 Sep 26;8(43):75308-75325. PMID: 29088867
citations.BibTeX: @article{29088867, title={Metformin treatment after the hypoxia-ischemia attenuates brain injury in newborn rats}, author={Fang M and Jiang H and Ye L and Cai C and Hu Y and Pan S and Li P and Xiao J and Lin Z}, journal={Oncotarget}, volume={8}, number={43}, pages={75308-75325}}

results.title: Improvement of functional recovery by chronic metformin treatment is associated with enhanced alternative activation of microglia/macrophages and increased angiogenesis and neurogenesis following experimental stroke.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ also significantly increased angiogenesis and neurogenesis in the @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020520 @@@ischemic brain@@@.

citations.NLM: Jin Q, Cheng J, Liu Y, Wu J, Wang X, Wei S, Zhou X, Qin Z, Jia J, Zhen X. Improvement of functional recovery by chronic metformin treatment is associated with enhanced alternative activation of microglia/macrophages and increased angiogenesis and neurogenesis following experimental stroke. Brain Behav Immun. 2014 Aug;40():131-42. PMID: 24632338

results.title: Involvement of arterial baroreflex and nicotinic acetylcholine receptor alpha7 subunit pathway in the protection of metformin against stroke in stroke-prone spontaneously hypertensive rats.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Met@@@ up-regulated the expression of @GENE_SLC18A3 @GENE_20508 @@@vesicular acetylcholine transporter@@@ (@GENE_SLC18A3 @GENE_20508 @@@VAChT@@@) and @GENE_CHRNA7 @GENE_11441 @@@alpha7nAChR@@@, down-regulated the level of pro-inflammtory cytokines in serum and @<m>DISEASE_Brain_Infarction</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020520 @@@peri-infarct of ischemic brain@@@.

citations.NLM: Guo JM, Zhang L, Niu XC, Shu H, Wang L, Su DF, Zhang Y, Liu AJ, Zhu DQ, Xu JJ. Involvement of arterial baroreflex and nicotinic acetylcholine receptor alpha7 subunit pathway in the protection of metformin against stroke in stroke-prone spontaneously hypertensive rats. Eur J Pharmacol. 2017 Mar 5;798():1-8. PMID: 28132912
